docs.lead_paragraph: Missouri's Republican-controlled Legislature gave final approval Wednesday to legislation requiring a woman to wait three days after first seeing a doctor before having an abortion. Democratic Gov. Jay Nixon has not said whether he will sign or veto it.

headline.main: Missouri Lawmakers Pass 3-Day Abortion Wait Period
headline.print_headline: Missouri Lawmakers Pass 3-Day Abortion Wait Period

docs.snippet: Missouri's Republican-controlled Legislature gave final approval Wednesday to legislation requiring a woman to wait three days after first seeing a doctor before having an abortion. Democratic Gov. Jay Nixon has not said whether he will sign or veto...

docs.lead_paragraph: An alarming number of babies in a rural swath of central Washington state over the last four years have been born with a rare and fatal defect that leaves them without part of their brain and skull, and scientists are stumped.

headline.main: Birth Defect in Some Rural Washington State Babies Stumps Scientists
headline.print_headline: Birth Defect in Some Rural Washington State Babies Stumps Scientists

docs.snippet: An alarming number of babies in a rural swath of central Washington state over the last four years have been born with a rare and fatal defect that leaves them without part of their brain and skull, and scientists are stumped.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Associated Press is all over the Cannes Film Festival — from its glitzy premieres to the celeb parties and quirky moments in between. Here's what reporters have seen and heard:

headline.main: CANNES WATCH: Lively Soars, Kidman Talks Lows
headline.print_headline: CANNES WATCH: Lively Soars, Kidman Talks Lows

docs.lead_paragraph: North Dakota's attorney general said Wednesday the state was appealing a judge's ruling that overturned a state law banning abortions as soon as a fetal heartbeat can be detected, which can be as early as six weeks into a pregnancy.

headline.main: ND Appealing Judge's Ruling on 6-Week Abortion Ban
headline.print_headline: ND Appealing Judge's Ruling on 6-Week Abortion Ban

docs.snippet: North Dakota's attorney general said Wednesday the state was appealing a judge's ruling that overturned a state law banning abortions as soon as a fetal heartbeat can be detected, which can be as early as six weeks into a pregnancy.

docs.lead_paragraph: Uganda has made it a crime to "wilfully and intentionally" transmit the HIV virus and made it legal for medical staff to disclose a patient’s HIV status to others without his or her consent.

headline.main: Uganda Makes 'Intentional Transmission' of HIV a Crime
headline.print_headline: Uganda Makes 'Intentional Transmission' of HIV a Crime

docs.snippet: Uganda has made it a crime to "wilfully and intentionally" transmit the HIV virus and made it legal for medical staff to disclose a patient’s HIV status to others without his or her consent.

docs.lead_paragraph: Grace Kelly can bring to mind several things: an Oscar-winning Hollywood actress, a mother, a princess and a Nicole Kidman movie premiering at the Cannes Film Festival.

headline.main: CANNES WATCH: Kelly Brought Glamour to Monaco
headline.print_headline: CANNES WATCH: Kelly Brought Glamour to Monaco

docs.lead_paragraph: We can transform “sex education” from something dirty into a vital tool of progress.
docs.snippet: We can transform “sex education” from something dirty into a vital tool of progress.

docs.lead_paragraph: A federal appeals court appeared poised Tuesday to continue blocking the nation's strictest restrictions on the use of abortion drugs, questioning the constitutionality of the Arizona rules a month after putting them on hold.

headline.main: Court Appears Poised Keep Blocking Abortion Rules
headline.print_headline: Court Appears Poised Keep Blocking Abortion Rules

docs.snippet: A federal appeals court appeared poised Tuesday to continue blocking the nation's strictest restrictions on the use of abortion drugs, questioning the constitutionality of the Arizona rules a month after putting them on hold.

docs.lead_paragraph: Twin girls born with a rare condition in Ohio were breathing on their own and their mom said she and her husband were able to hold them on Mother's Day.

headline.main: Rare 'Mono Mono' Newborn Twins Doing Well in Ohio
headline.print_headline: Rare 'Mono Mono' Newborn Twins Doing Well in Ohio

docs.snippet: Twin girls born with a rare condition in Ohio were breathing on their own and their mom said she and her husband were able to hold them on Mother's Day.
